page.title: 07Yattendon School
page.content: Yattendon School is a Church of England (Aided) School. This means that the Rector, who lives next door, comes in every Monday morning to take our Assembly. We also go to the church twice a term for services. Everyone studies Religious Education though it's not just about the Bible. We learn about things going on in the world, wars and famines and why some countries which are rich and well-fed can't seem to help the poor and starving ones. There are 44 children at school between the ages of five and eleven. There are two full-time teachers and one half-time. The Headteacher lives in Curridge and the Infant teacher in Ashmore Green. The part=time teacher lives in the School house, but this is only until her new house in Newbury has been built.
